intro: Pentagonia monocaulis, commonly known as the single-stemmed pentagonia, is a unique species within the Apocynaceae family. It is characterized by its distinct pentagonal shape, which is most evident in its stem and leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with opposite, ovate leaves that have a smooth texture. Its flowers are clustered in umbels and are usually yellow or greenish-yellow, attracting various pollinators. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
